miaTime 0.1.3
  • Get started
  • Reference

Beta diversity calculation within individuals in the interval of n time steps

Source: R/getTimeDivergence.R
getTimeDivergence.Rd

The dissimilarity (beta diversity) is calculated in time steps of n, between the samples of subject (individuals).Time interval can be 1 or greater than 1. The time difference between n points is also calculated. Given input, SummarizedExperiment or TreeSummarizedExperiment object, returns with the calculations inserted in columns of colData field.

check_pairwise_dist(
  x,
  distfun,
  time_interval,
  new_field = "time_divergence",
  new_field2 = "time_difference",
  time_field,
  abund_values
)

getTimeDivergence(
  se,
  field,
  time_field,
  time_interval,
  new_field = "time_divergence",
  new_field2 = "time_difference",
  abund_values = "counts"
)

Arguments

x

a SummarizedExperiment object or a TreeSummarizedExperiment of an individual with multiple samples

distfun

a function that uses vegan::vegdist as the default value to calculate beta diversity. (default: distfun = vegan::vegdist)

time_interval

integer value indicating the increment between the time steps. It can be 1 or higher than 1. (default: time_interval = 1)

new_field

a column vector showing beta diversity between samples over n time intervals (default: new_field = "time_divergence")

new_field2

a column vector showing the time difference between samples used to calculate beta diversity (default: new_field2 = "time_difference")

time_field

a single character value for specifying time series vector given in colData field.

abund_values

character indicating which abundance values are used in the assay of SE and TSE (default: abund_values = "counts")

se

A SummarizedExperiment object or TreeSummarizedExperiment

field

a single character value for specifying which grouping factor chosen from columns of colData field.

Value

a SummarizedExperimentor TreeSummarizedExperimentcontaining the beta diversity and time difference between samples in n time steps

Examples

library(miaTime)
data(hitchip1006)

sub_hitchip <- hitchip1006[,800:1151]
